author: Maane Khatchatourian
title: 'Twilight' gets gender-swapped new novel 'Life and Death'
text:
"Twilight" is getting a gender swap.
Author Stephenie Meyer
has published a new book in honor of the 10th anniversary of the best-selling franchise, with the genders of the original protagonists switched. Bella Swan's character is now a male named Beau and Edward Cullen
is now a female named Edythe in the 442-page novel, titled "Life and Death: Twilight Reimagined," available for purchase Tuesday. Meyer writes in her foreword to the anniversary edition of the book that the gender bending twist was prompted by her desire to stress that Bella isn't a "damsel in distress," but a a "human in distress."
Meyer was set to release " Midnight Sun ," a spinoff told from Edward's point of view, years ago, before a draft of the book leaked online. Fans were hoping that it would be included in the bonus content in this anniversary edition, but Meyers notes in the foreword that she didn't have the time to publish the story.
